content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK  September 27 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings expects to assign a 'BB+' rating to Bancolombia's upcoming U.S. dollar subordinated notes. The notes (for an amount to be determined) will pay a fixed interest to be set at the time of the issuance. The notes will mature on 2027  and interest payments will be made semi-annually until maturity. The final rating is contingent on receipt of final documents conforming materially to the preliminar
name: BanColombia SA
title: Fitch Expects to Rate Bancolombia's Subordinated Notes 'BB+'

content: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) NEW YORK/BOGOTA  October 30 (Fitch) On Sept. 11  2015  Bancolombia announced an  agreement to acquire an additional 20% stake in Banco Agromercantil de Guatemala  (BAM) which would bring the bank's share of BAM's equity to 60%. Once the  transaction is approved by regulators in both countries and closed  Bancolombia  would gain control of BAM and consolidate it as a new subsidiary.
